Course Name: ACG 2030 - CAPSTONE REVIEW COURSE FOR ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES
Course Title: CAPSTONE REVIEW COURSE FOR ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES
Statewide Course: CAPSTONE REVIEW COURSE OF ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES
Prerequisites: ACG 2021, ACG 2071, ACG 2100, ACG 2450, AND ACG 2630
Course Description:
THIS COURSE GUIDES THE STUDENT IN DEALING WITH ETHICS, INTERNAL CONTROL, FRAUD AND FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS IN THE ACCOUNTING
ENVIRONMENT, INCLUDING CONFRONTING AND RESOLVING ACCOUNTING PROBLEMS BY INTEGRATING AND APPLYING SKILLS AND TECHNIQUES ACQUIRED IN THEIR PREVIOUS COURSES, AIDING STUDENTS IN DEVELOPING A PERSONAL CODE OF ETHICS BY EXPLORING ETHICAL DILEMMAS AND PRESSURES THEY WILL FACE AS ACCOUNTANTS, AND HELPING THE STUDENT UNDERSTAND FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS AND ITS RELATIONSHIP TO FRAUD AND FRAUD DETECTION.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1. CONFRONT AND RESOLVE ACCOUNTING PROBLEMS BY INTEGRATING AND APPLYING SKILLS AND
TECHNIQUES ACQUIRED IN THEIR PREVIOUS COURSES.
2. DEVELOP A PERSONAL CODE OF ETHICS BY EXPLORING ETHICAL DILEMMAS AND PRESSURES THEY WILL
FACE AS ACCOUNTANTS.
3. PREPARE A COMPLETE FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS.
4. RELATE FRAUD AND FRAUD DETECTION TO THE PREPARATION OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
5. PASS THE ACAT COMPREHENSIVE EXAMINATION FOR ACCREDITATION IN ACCOUNTANCY.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
